metadata.feature_description: Core functionality for creating and managing multi-column layouts on pages, including default layout creation and column configuration.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Get existing layout for a module

steps.expected: User should be logged in successfully
steps.actual: Successfully logged in as SuperUser Account

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enter edit mode
steps.expected: Page should show edit mode with module controls
steps.actual: Edit mode activated, pane labels and module controls visible

steps.action: Scroll down to view Content Layout modules
steps.expected: Content Layout modules should be visible with 4 columns
steps.actual: Content Layout modules visible with F30A_Pane1-4 and 9977_Pane1-4, showing TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS

steps.action: Click on Content Layout to view column sizes
steps.expected: Column sizes should be displayed as percentages

steps.action: Drag resize handle between first and second column to resize
steps.expected: Columns should resize and show new percentages
steps.actual: Successfully dragged handle, first column became wider

steps.action: Click on layout to verify new column sizes
steps.expected: New column sizes should be displayed
steps.actual: Column sizes changed to 30%, 20%, 25%, 25% - resizing worked correctly

steps.action: Navigate to home page in view mode (without edit mode)
steps.expected: Layout should render correctly with proper column arrangement
steps.actual: Layout renders with 4 columns side by side, responsive grid visible

steps.action: Scroll down to view Content Layout modules in view mode
steps.expected: Both Content Layout modules should display their content in 4 columns
steps.actual: First row shows TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS. Second row shows HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, CAMERAS. All in proper 4-column grid layout.

steps.action: Enter edit mode on the home page
steps.expected: Layout should show edit controls, pane labels, and resize handles
steps.actual: Edit mode shows pane labels (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4), module action buttons, resize handles between columns, and 'Add Existing Module' links

steps.action: View Content Layout module columns in edit mode
steps.expected: Columns should be visible with edit controls and empty pane placeholders
steps.actual: Columns visible with modules (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, LAPTOPS), one empty pane showing 'Click to add text/image/module' buttons, resize handles visible between columns

steps.action: Inspect CSS classes on Content Layout panes via JavaScript
steps.expected: Panes should have Bootstrap-style responsive CSS classes
steps.actual: CSS classes verified: F30A panes have 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12' (25% on lg/md/sm, 100% on xs). 9977 panes have 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12' matching the default 4x25% template. Additional classes include ui-resizable, dnnSortable, dnnModuleManager for edit mode functionality.

steps.action: Verify existing Content Layout module shows default 4-column layout
steps.expected: Module should display default layout of 25%, 25%, 25%, 25%
steps.actual: Module displays 4 equal columns at 25% each, matching the default column sizes constant '25,25,25' from code (Constants.DefaultColumnSizes)

steps.action: Verify layout templates are configured in data.xml
steps.expected: Six layout templates should be available
steps.actual: Code review confirmed 6 templates available: 25%+75%, 75%+25%, 50%+50%, 25%+50%+25%, 33%+33%+33%, 4x25%. Templates defined in Templates/data.xml with Id, Name, Icon, and Sizes attributes.

observations: The Content Layout module creates dynamic panes (F30A_Pane1-4, 9977_Pane1-4) that act as containers for other modules
Column resize functionality uses jQuery UI resizable with drag handles, automatically calculating percentages
CSS classes use Bootstrap's 12-column grid system (col-lg-*, col-md-*, col-sm-*, col-xs-*) for responsive layouts
The module removes certain action buttons (Settings, Import, Export) when it contains child modules to prevent nested Content Layout issues
Code suggests validation prevents column sizes from exceeding 99% total and limits to maximum 4 columns (3 comma-separated values)
Page versioning system integration allows tracking of layout changes through IVersionableControl interface
The LayoutEditor.js handles real-time resize visualization with percentage displays during drag operations
